title: Does high cholesterol run in your family? Inculcate these habits for a healthier life
description: On one hand, there are some people whose LDL levels skyrocket due to their dietary and lifestyle choices like excess intake of saturated and trans fats, lack of exercise, high intake of sugar, alcohol, and smoking; there are others who genetically have high cholesterol levels.

title: New Nanoparticle-Based Rapid Covid-19 Test Is More Sensitive, Durable
description: The gold standard test for COVID-19 diagnosis remains the reverse transcription-polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR). Although this test is highly sensitive and specific, it generally takes 1-2 days to get a result, is expensive and requires special lab equipment and trained personnel.
content: Scientists have developed a more sensitive and durable rapid COVID-19 test that uses polymer nanoparticles, rather than antibodies, to detect the SARS-CoV-2 virus. Rapid antigen tests can quickly and conveniently tell a person that they are positive ... [2337 chars]

title: Explained: What is Zika and why it could cause the next pandemic according to WHO
description: Fears around Zika primarily involve microcephaly, especially when pregnant women are infected.

title: IBS Vs IBD: Types, Causes, Symptoms and Diagnosis
description: People often confuse between IBS and IBD and use the medical terms for one another. This article will educate you about the two conditions in detail.

description: The Sun has published the medical case of a man who was left in intensive care after he suffered a rare injury from masturbating. The medics were stunned as the symptoms he manifested were of a lung injury – usually caused by coughing fits or rigorous exercise.

title: Vaccination greatly lowers infectious viral load in Covid patients: Study
description: Getting vaccinated against COVID-19 may significantly lower infectious viral load in people infected with the SARS-CoV-2, according to a study. The researchers noted that measuring the viral load of people infected with SARS-CoV-2 is one of the main factors in evaluating the infectiousness of COVID-19 patients. Viral load can be influenced by the infecting SARS-CoV-2 variant
